Key Match Events: Vincent Aboubaker opened the scoring in the eighth minute with a penalty kick
Martin Hongla doubled Cameroon's lead in the 39th minute
Michael Olunga scored for Kenya in the 41st minute to reduce the lead
Bryan Mbuemo restored Cameroon's two-goal cushion in the dying minutes of the first half
Christian Bassogog scored the final goal of the encounter in the 55th minute
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw Cameroon remain top of the Group J standings with seven points after three games, two points ahead of second-placed Zimbabwe
Cameroon showed resilience and the drive to score from the very beginning
The result sees Cameroon beat Kenya 4-1 at the Japoma Stadium in Douala, Cameroon
Others: The Harambee Stars managed to pull a goal back through Michael Olunga in the 41st minute, reducing the lead and causing Cameroon a bit of tension as the first half drew to a close
Changes were made by Kenya coach Engin Firat, but they were unfortunately unable to recover
